titleStmt.title: A declaration set forth by the Frenche kinge, shewing his pleasure concerning the new troubles in his realme. Translated out of French into English by E.A.
titleStmt.author: France. Sovereign (1574-1589 : Henry III)

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A02951 of text S119791 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 13092). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 47 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 17 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A declaration set forth by the Frenche kinge, shewing his pleasure concerning the new troubles in his realme. Translated out of French into English by E.A.
titleStmt.author: France. Sovereign (1574-1589 : Henry III)
Aggas, Edward.
Henry III, King of France, 1551-1589.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Iohn Wolfe dwelling in Distaffe lane neere the signe of the Castell,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Declaration de la volonté du roy sur les nouveaux troubles de ce royaume.

Preceeded on film by fragment detached from another work (with holding stamp of British Library) that begins on E3 and has caption title: A declaration of the causes that haue mooued the Cardinal of Bourbon, the princes, peeres, gentlemen, townes and comminalties Catholike of this realme of Fraunce, to oppose themselues to those which by all meanse do seeke to subuert the Catholike religion and the estate.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

keywords.term: France -- History -- Henry III, 1574-1589 -- Early works to 1800.
